column2: Gmail SMTP throws config reloader error on sign-up
column14: "Google Workspace Admin blocks SMTP relay for external apps. smtp.gmail.com:587 with App Password fails with Error 500: config reloader is exiting on the Supabase SMTP handler."
column15: "1. Configure Supabase SMTP with smtp.gmail.com:587 and Info@edmeca.co.za App Password. 2. Navigate to /login > Sign Up. 3. Enter valid email and password. 4. Click Create Account. 5. Observe 500 error in browser console."
column16: Sign-up succeeds and confirmation email delivered
column17: Error: SMTP config reloader is exiting. Sign-up fails for all new users.
column18: "Removed Gmail SMTP configuration from Supabase. Switched to Resend email delivery service. Created Resend API key. Added DNS records: DKIM TXT (resend._domainkey)
column20: MX (send). Configured Supabase SMTP: smtp.resend.com:465 with API key as password."
column27: "Google Workspace admin setting (Allow less secure apps / SMTP relay) was disabled. App Passwords tried but blocked at Google level. Resend used as permanent replacement."

column2: Confirmation email delivered to spam folder
column14: "No DMARC policy record in DNS. New sender domain (edmeca.co.za) with no historical sending reputation causes Gmail to classify mail as spam or junk."
column15: "1. Configure Resend as SMTP with DKIM and SPF only (no DMARC). 2. Complete sign-up flow. 3. Check Gmail inbox primary tab. 4. Check spam/junk folder."
column16: Confirmation email arrives in primary Gmail inbox
column17: Confirmation email received in spam / junk folder
column18: "Added DMARC TXT record to IT-Guru DNS: _dmarc.edmeca.co.za → v=DMARC1; p=none; rua=mailto:Info@edmeca.co.za. Deliverability to improve as sender reputation builds over time."
column25: "DMARC p=none (monitor mode) chosen to avoid blocking legitimate mail during initial setup. Can escalate to p=quarantine after monitoring period. Gmail reputation improvement is gradual."

column2: Google OAuth consent screen shows Supabase URL
column14: "Google Cloud OAuth consent screen not configured. App name and domain not set. App is in Testing mode. Supabase callback URL appears as the authorised redirect
column15: so Google shows the Supabase project URL to end users on the consent screen."
column16: "1. Navigate to /login. 2. Click Continue with Google. 3. Observe consent screen header. 4. Note the name and URL shown to user."
column17: Consent screen shows EdMeCa Academy as the app name and edmeca.co.za
column18: Consent screen shows Supabase project URL instead of EdMeCa Academy name
column19: "PENDING: Supervisor Raymond Crow to update Google Cloud Console → APIs & Services → OAuth consent screen: set app name to EdMeCa Academy
column20: set homepage and privacy URLs to edmeca.co.za
column22: publish app (move from Testing to Production)."
column29: "OAuth flow itself works. Only branding/UX concern. In Testing mode only verified test users (added manually) can sign in. Publish required for general user access."

column2: Missing logo asset breaks BMCTool build
column14: "BMCTool.tsx was integrated from EDMECA-BMC-main codebase which had its logo at attached_assets/EdMeca_LOGOMARK_A4_2024_1767948366417.jpg. That file was not copied to the Edmeca-Website project. Vite @assets alias resolves to attached_assets/ which did not contain the file
column16: "1. Checkout development branch. 2. Run npm run dev or npm run build. 3. Observe Vite import-analysis error on BMCTool.tsx line 3."
column17: App builds successfully and logo renders in BMC tool welcome screen
column18: "[plugin:vite:import-analysis] Failed to resolve import @assets/EdMeca_LOGOMARK_A4_2024_1767948366417.jpg. Build fails."
column19: "Replaced missing @assets import with const edmecaLogo = '/logo.png' — uses the existing logo.png already present in client/public/ which is served at root by Vite."
column20: fix: resolve missing BMC logo asset [3.15]
column26: "logo.png in client/public/ is the canonical project logo used across email templates and site. No asset copy needed."

column2: BMC Finalize fails — version column missing from artifacts
column14: "shared/schema.ts defines version INTEGER DEFAULT 1 on the artifacts table but the initial SQL migration (20260216085856_initial_schema.sql) omitted the column. Supabase PostgREST schema cache does not know about the column
column16: "1. Log in on staging. 2. Complete BMC tool canvas. 3. Click Finalize & Save. 4. Observe error in console: Could not find the version column of artifacts in the schema cache."
column17: BMC canvas saves successfully to Supabase artifacts table
column18: Error: Could not find the 'version' column of 'artifacts' in the schema cache. Save fails.
column19: "1. Removed version: 1 from the supabase.from(artifacts).insert() call in BMCTool.tsx so the save works immediately. 2. Created migration 20260220120000_add_version_to_artifacts.sql to add the column to the live DB (run via Supabase dashboard SQL editor or supabase db push)."
column20: fix: remove version field from BMC insert
column27: "Run migration 20260220120000_add_version_to_artifacts.sql in Supabase dashboard to fully sync schema. Short-term: version omitted from insert so default still applies once column is added."

column2: Tool data lost on navigation without Finalize
column16: PitchBuilderTool) held all in-progress form state in React useState. No save to Supabase until Finalize was clicked. Navigating away unmounted the component and destroyed all unsaved state."
column17: "1. Log in and navigate to /portal/tools/swot. 2. Add several strengths
column19: and PESTLE items. 3. Click ← Dashboard without clicking Finalize. 4. Navigate back to /portal/tools/swot. 5. Observe all entered items are gone."
column20: Previously entered items persist when user returns to the tool
column21: All unsaved data is lost on navigation — user must re-enter everything
column25: calls artifactsService.saveArtifact() with status=in_progress silently. Uses hasLoadedRef to skip initial mount population and existingIdRef to avoid stale closures. Also replaced raw supabase calls in saveMutation with saveArtifact helper. ProgressTrackerTool unaffected — each item saved to DB immediately on add."
column26: fix: implement auto-save for portal tools [3.4]
column34: PitchBuilderTool. ProgressTrackerTool not affected. Auto-save fires silently — no toast — to avoid interrupting the user."

column2: Login button navigates despite disabled attribute
column14: "Production Header.tsx wrapped disabled <button> in <a href=/login> anchor tag. HTML disabled attribute only applies to form elements; <a> ignores it. Clicking the button area still triggered anchor navigation."
column15: "1. Ensure VITE_ENABLE_LOGIN is not set in environment. 2. Build and deploy to production. 3. Navigate to https://edmeca.co.za. 4. Click the Log In button. 5. Observe navigation to /login despite button appearing disabled."
column16: Clicking disabled login button produces no action
column17: Clicking disabled login button navigates to /login page
column18: "Refactored Header.tsx: isLoginEnabled = import.meta.env.VITE_ENABLE_LOGIN === 'true'. When false: render plain disabled <button> only with no anchor wrapper. When true: render <a href=/login> wrapping <button>."
column25: "Fix also applied to mobile navigation menu. Both desktop and mobile login buttons use same isLoginEnabled conditional."

column2: Previous user's data leaks into new account on same browser session
column14: "useAuth hook called supabase.auth.signOut() but never called queryClient.clear(). React Query in-memory cache (userProfile
column15: artifacts) persisted across the sign-out boundary. When a new user signed in on the same browser session
column16: React Query served the stale cached data from the previous user before new queries resolved."
column17: "1. Log in as User A. 2. Save a business name on /portal/profile. 3. Sign out. 4. Create a new account as User B. 5. Navigate to /portal or any tool. 6. Observe User A's business name appearing as User B's business name."
column18: New account starts with empty profile and no artifacts
column19: New account inherits previous user's business name and artifact data
column20: "Added queryClient.clear() call inside onAuthStateChange handler in use-auth.ts when event === 'SIGNED_OUT'. This wipes all React Query in-memory cache so no stale user data persists to the next session."
column21: fix: clear React Query cache on sign-out to prevent data leak to new accounts [3.14]
column27: "queryClient imported from @/lib/queryClient. Fix applies to all cached queries — userProfile
column29: and any future queries. Critical privacy/security issue for any shared-device scenario."
